name: Amoud Foundation
mission: Founded in 1998, the Amoud Foundation impacts the local and global communities by helping people help themselves through sustainable humanitarian projects while maintaining trusting relationships. Amoud is an international humanitarian organization that today serves the people in the Horn of Africa. Amoud also does work on the home-front including helping with the 2006 Hurricane Relief and 2015 Garland Tornado recovery.
theoryOfChange: Amoud Foundation states it helps people help themselves through sustainable humanitarian projects while maintaining trusting relationships, and relieves suffering by establishing emergency relief and development programs.
zakatClaimEvidence: Dedicated zakat page found at https://www.amoudfoundation.org/zakat (Source: https://www.amoudfoundation.org/zakat)

ui_signals_v1.recommendation_rationale: Good donor alignment with manageable risk. Evidence quality is solid but still evolving in places.

components.evidence: Explicit zakat program (+4); Muslim-focused organization (+2); Asnaf: fuqara (+5); Operates in Muslim-majority regions (+3); Strong humanitarian service (+4)
components.name: Muslim Donor Fit

components.improvement_suggestion: Expand services to underserved populations or geographies with limited nonprofit coverage.
components.name: Underserved Space

alignment.rationale: Alignment 36/50: HIGH Muslim donor fit, religious cultural cause area

components.improvement_suggestion: If reserves are above policy target, document why and publish triggers for planned deployment.
components.name: Financial Health

components.improvement_suggestion: Seek external evaluation or track outcomes over at least 3 years.
components.name: Evidence & Outcomes

risks.description: No outcome measurement or metrics tracking

score_details.score_summary: AMOUD FOUNDATION shows exceptional impact and strong alignment, with zakat compliance (minor risk deductions applied).

zakat.claim_evidence: Dedicated zakat page found at https://www.amoudfoundation.org/zakat (Source: https://www.amoudfoundation.org/zakat)

all_citations.claim: The charity earned a score of 88.5/100 and maintains a program expense ratio of 89.3%.
The foundation is Zakat-eligible and provides details on its zakat policy and asnaf categories.
The organization offers various donation options and giving methods for supporters.
The foundation reported total revenue of $9,535,194 and supports 15 orphan centers and 2 schools for the deaf/blind.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The foundation earns a strong overall rating due to its high financial efficiency and direct service model, though its score is moderated by medium data confidence.
areas_for_improvement: Limited third-party impact data beyond financial reporting
Data confidence is currently rated as medium

dimension_explanations.alignment: Amoud Foundation is highly aligned with Muslim donor priorities as a Zakat-eligible organization that follows specific asnaf categories for distribution [2]. Its focus on orphans and religious-cultural urgency contributes to a high donor fit score [2][3].
dimension_explanations.impact: The organization demonstrates high financial health with a program expense ratio of 89.3% and a direct service model that provides food packages and healthcare to those in need [1][5]. With a cost per beneficiary of approximately $11.29, the foundation shows a strong ability to convert revenue into tangible aid [1].

baseline_narrative.headline: Amoud Foundation provides critical humanitarian relief and educational support to vulnerable orphans and students across East Africa.
strengths: High program expense ratio of 89.3%, ensuring the vast majority of funds reach beneficiaries
Exceptional fundraising efficiency with a cost of $0.00 per $1 raised
Strong liquidity with 12.7 months of working capital available
baseline_narrative.summary: Amoud Foundation is a non-profit organization dedicated to supporting 15 orphan centers and specialized schools for deaf and blind students [1][5]. The foundation reported a total revenue of $9,535,194 and maintains a high level of financial transparency, earning a Charity Navigator score of 88.5/100 [1][5].

all_citations.quote: Your Zakat helps us provide food, water, and education.

rich_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The foundation earns a strong overall rating due to its high financial efficiency and direct service model, though its score is moderated by medium data confidence.

areas_for_improvement.context: While financial transparency is high, the organization currently has <cite id="1">unverified external outcome tracking</cite>, which limits the ability to measure long-term efficacy.
With <cite id="1">high working capital</cite>, the foundation could improve transparency by publishing specific triggers for the deployment of these reserves.

bbb_assessment.summary: BBB Wise Giving Alliance data is not currently available for this organization.

case_against.mitigation_notes: The organization maintains a clear, documented theory of change to guide its internal operations.
risk_factors: <cite id="1">Unverified evidence and outcomes</cite> from external evaluators
case_against.summary: The primary limitation is the <cite id="1">lack of third-party impact data</cite> beyond internal financial reporting.

confidence.data_freshness: Data current as of 2023 tax year
confidence.notes: Strong financial data but limited external impact verification.

alignment.explanation: The foundation is a strong fit for Muslim donors, offering <cite id="2">verified Zakat eligibility</cite> and serving <cite id="2">underserved populations in Muslim-majority regions</cite>.
alignment.improvement: Alignment could be further enhanced by <cite id="1">expanding services</cite> to additional underserved geographies with limited nonprofit coverage.

credibility.explanation: Donors can trust this charity due to its <cite id="1">28-year track record</cite> and an <cite id="1">Accountability & Finance score of 88</cite>. The organization maintains a <cite id="5">board of 6 members</cite> and undergoes independent financial reporting.
credibility.improvement: To strengthen credibility, the foundation could seek <cite id="1">external evaluations</cite> to verify its reported impact metrics over a multi-year period.

impact.explanation: Operations are highly efficient with a <cite id="5">89.3% program ratio</cite> and a <cite id="1">direct service delivery model</cite> that minimizes overhead.
impact.improvement: Impact measurement would benefit from <cite id="1">tracking long-term outcomes</cite> for students in their specialized schools for the deaf and blind.

donor_fit_matrix.evidence_rigor: Grade C - Strong financial data with implicit outcome tracking

grantmaking_profile.grant_strategy: Direct service delivery rather than grantmaking

rich_narrative.headline: Amoud Foundation provides critical humanitarian relief and educational support to vulnerable orphans and students across East Africa.

ideal_donor_profile.best_for_summary: Best for donors who prioritize high financial efficiency and want to support specialized humanitarian needs like orphan care and disability education in East Africa.
donor_motivations: Want to ensure nearly 100% of their donation reaches the field
Care about the welfare of orphans and students with disabilities
Value long-standing organizations with deep roots in Somalia
Seek Zakat-eligible giving opportunities with low overhead
giving_considerations: The organization has very high reserves, suggesting long-term stability
Impact is measured primarily through internal reporting rather than external RCTs
Focus is highly localized to the Somali region
ideal_donor_profile.not_ideal_for: Donors seeking large-scale advocacy or those who require independent, third-party academic impact evaluations

impact_evidence.evidence_grade_explanation: Grade C reflects strong internal tracking and financial transparency but a lack of external, independent impact evaluations.
impact_evidence.theory_of_change_summary: The foundation provides direct assistance to orphan centers and schools to improve life outcomes for vulnerable children in Somalia.
impact_evidence.why_evidence_matters: Evidence ensures that the high percentage of funds spent on programs is translating into measurable improvements in beneficiary lives.

long_term_outlook.room_for_funding_explanation: The foundation has a high funding gap and a growing revenue trend, suggesting it can effectively absorb more capital for its 15 orphan centers.

peer_comparison.differentiator: Amoud Foundation's <cite id="5">89.3% program ratio</cite> is significantly higher than the <cite id="1">peer median of 89.8%</cite>.

similar_organizations.differentiator: Similar focus on humanitarian relief and size
similar_organizations.name: Abdul Sattar Edhi International Foundation

similar_organizations.differentiator: Larger organization with similar orphan care focus
similar_organizations.name: Hidaya Foundation

strengths.detail: The organization directs <cite id="5">89.3% of its total expenses</cite> toward its programs, significantly exceeding the <cite id="1">industry standard of 75%</cite>.
Amoud Foundation maintains <cite id="1">12.7 months of operating reserves</cite>, providing a significant buffer against funding fluctuations.
The foundation explicitly <cite id="2">accepts Zakat</cite> and directs funds to eligible categories including <cite id="2">fuqara (the poor) and masakin (the needy)</cite>.

strengths_deep_dive: Amoud Foundation's impact is rooted in its direct service delivery model, which allows for a remarkably low <cite id="1">cost per beneficiary of approximately $11.29</cite>. This efficiency is supported by a <cite id="5">3-year revenue CAGR of 18.6%</cite>, indicating steady growth and increasing donor trust. The organization's leadership is highly rated, earning a <cite id="1">perfect 100/100 Leadership & Adaptability score</cite> from Charity Navigator, which reflects strategic clarity and a documented theory of change.
rich_narrative.summary: founded in 1998, Amoud Foundation has established itself as a critical lifeline for vulnerable populations in East Africa, specifically focusing on <cite id="1">Somaliland and Somalia</cite>. The organization operates with a high degree of financial efficiency, reporting <cite id="5">$9,535,194 in total revenue</cite> for the 2023 tax year. Its primary mission involves the <cite id="1">support of 15 orphan centers</cite> and specialized educational facilities for deaf and blind students, ensuring that those often marginalized by society receive essential care and resources. The foundation's operational model is characterized by an <cite id="5">exceptional program expense ratio of 89.3%</cite>, meaning nearly every dollar donated is converted into direct services. This lean structure is further evidenced by its <cite id="1">fundraising efficiency of $0.00 per $1 raised</cite>, a rare metric that indicates the organization relies heavily on organic growth and volunteer networks rather than expensive marketing campaigns. With a <cite id="1">Charity Navigator score of 88.5/100</cite>, Amoud Foundation demonstrates strong accountability and leadership, maintaining <cite id="1">12.7 months of working capital</cite> to ensure organizational stability in the volatile humanitarian landscape of the Horn of Africa.
